result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance D Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lance D Smith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges. On one or more other charges, Lance D Smith was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lance D Smith is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Lance D Smith was found guilty of Possession of Firearm by Felon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Lance D Smith was found guilty of Possession of Firearm by Felon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with SB or KT.

Completion of aggression or certified abuser treatment required by agent.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Court gave oath to M.M.  Direct exam by ADA Stephan.  Venue established.  ADA moved court to find that counts 1 & 4 are transactionally related.  Atty Cuevas states they are two different dates and two different apartments and objects.   Court finds counts 1 & 4 are transactionally related for reasons outlined on record.  Witness identified defendant.  Cross exam by Atty Cuevas.  ADA moves for bindover, waives argument, reserves argument for rebuttal.   Atty Cuevas wiaves argument and opposes bindover.   Court binds case over to Br.  7.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Court made record that at last hearing Atty S. Taylor was allowed to withdraw - communications broken down.  Mr. Thomas was retained and is here today.  Atty Thomas moves to withdraw as Mr. Smith is unable to compensate him.  Court states SPD may reappoint.  Defn has no objection to Atty Thomas withdrawing.  Court informed defn that SPD will only allow two attorneys and he already had Atty Taylor withdraw.  Court states at some point there will be a time when the court will find defn waives counsel.   Atty Stephan states court could set for PH since court made record about SPD only appointing one more attorney.  Court would like to set for STC.  Atty Stehan has no objection to granting Atty Thomas' request to withdraw.  Court grants request.   Court advised defn to contact SPD to get new attorney.  Defn states he spoke with Attorney Luis Cuevas already today.  1:50 p.m. Atty Cuevas appeared and thought it was already set for a PH.  Court informed him it was only set for STC today.   Atty Cuevas wants case set for PH.  Court finds good cause to set over to 3/18/14 @ 11:00 a.m.
